column4: resio: I am having trouble installing 11.10. I am on windows 7. when i boot from usb or dvd I get the options to try, install or check disc
when I select any of them, my screen goes black
what GPU do you use?
yes it does
add the boot option: nouveau.blacklist=1
How do I do that?
some nvidia gpus don't like the nouveau driver. The option
makes it
try this: http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/09/live-usb-sticking-grub-2-video/
thanks, I'll check this out now
I was on here earlier trying to get help, and someone ended up giving me this http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1837235 said it was out of his abilities though :/
in an EEE PC....really?
would you not install proprietary drivers if the resolution is horrible?
if its an Intel GPU or a SiS GPU, there aren't any to install
i've never owned a eee pc, so I didn't know they were running intel graphics
then how can you advise? Not all systems need, or can even use proprietary drivers. Most netbooks use crappy Intel or SiS or Chrome GPUs.
sorry, I gave bad advice.
you can use rsync or dd to transfer over easily
might be a dumb question, but could I just cp instead of dd? then install grub on the new drive? or would that work?
sure but remember to preserve ownership, you will also need to install grub to the mbr of the sd card
so could I just use parted to partition the new drive, then copy everything over and do grub-install to /dev/sdb1 or whatever my boot partition will be?
/dev/sda  not /dev/sda1
yes, my bad
its annoying
